answers.answer: Hello and hope you are doing well.The symptom described by you could be due to neuropathy, which could have affected the facial nerve. It is a disorder of the nerves which causes numbness, tingling, unusual sensations and sometimes pain. Diabetes Mellitus can cause neuropathy. Other causes like vitamin deficiencies, alcohol consumption and certain medications can cause neuropathy. It could also be due to facial nerve paralysis. You may need to consult your primary care physician to detect the cause.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

question: About 3 months ago I was experiencing severe stress over my finances. It was to the point that one day I guess I strained hard. A facial strain. Forehead, bridge of my nose, jaws etc. Well this strain clinch apparently has remained instead of retracting to normal. As if it got stuck. Immediately afterward i had distorted vision etc. It has set off severe to mild panic attacks for that long. At first there was severe pressure between my eyes and and between my jaws. I was yawning about 3 weeks ago and the one between the jaws poped out. It made a crunching sound and it was gone. The one between my eyes remains. Its not a sinus infection. The pain is varies from moderate to severe depending on rest and stress. I can feel it sorta popping. I really just feels like it is stuck.Does anyone have a clue as to what this might be? A formal term?If so, how do I get rid of it?
title: I strained my face and It got stuck.  I believe. HELP!
